questions.question: The boys were playing games when it ………………………. raining.
questions.description: We usually use the simple past for an action that happens in the middle of another action.

questions.question: You were watching TV when I ……………………… for my exam.
questions.description: Continuous tenses are used to talk about two actions that were progressing at the same time.

questions.question: The phone ………………………. while I was cooking dinner.
questions.description: We usually use the simple past for an action that happens in the middle of another action.

questions.question: How long ……………………… a social activist?
questions.description: Perfect tenses are usually used to talk about duration.

questions.question: We …………………….. each other for a long time.
questions.description: We normally use perfect tenses with since and for.

questions.question: We ……………………… nothing from all the wars in history.
questions.description: When there is no reference to any specific past time, we usually use the present perfect to talk about finished actions or situations.

questions.question: I ………………………… well for the exam.
questions.description: When there is no reference to any specific past time, we usually use the present perfect to talk about finished actions or situations.

questions.question: I ……………………….. well for the exam, yet I failed.
questions.description: The past tense in the second clause clearly indicates that the reference is to the past time.

questions.question: The teacher ……………………… an interesting question in the class yesterday.
questions.description: When there is a definite past time reference we use the simple past to talk about finished actions or situations.

questions.question: I looked around but I ……………………. anyone.
questions.description: The reference is to the past time here.

questions.question: She threw a glass at me, but ……………………
questions.description: When one verb is in the past tense, the other verbs will most probably also be in the past tense.

questions.question: If you don’t hurry, you …………………. the train.
